1.content:
Bored. Bored bored bored. Boredom wrought Midna's mind. A while ago, she'd explored her realm, and eventually found a tremendous power. Power unlike any Twili had seen before. She could manipulate a mortal's mind, alter someone's body however she wished, reform the world however she wanted, even view into other timelines! And yet... she's bored. Being a god isn't always that great. It didn't take long for her to see just about everything. At least, what she thought was everything. She had yet to do anything really bad with her powers, and she wanted to see how much fun creating she could have with an enemy. And, she knew just the person to make into an enemy.

Link was no ordinary man. He had a courage unseen in most people. Having someone like that try to fight her, that could be the best thing! If she won, she could enjoy the struggle Link put up. If she lost, then that means there's just something else she could strive for with her powers! Now, first, she had to decide which Link. Her powers revealed to her multiple worlds, and multiple Links. Any of them could be fun. But which one would be more fun?
1.title: What Timeline?

choices: Change the enemies he was going to face
Have April and May follow Link to mess with him
11.content:
Midna decided to pick her own Link, the one she had traveled with. The princess traveled back in time to see him. She went all the way back before they met and landed in Ordon village. Keeping herself hidden, she looked around the peaceful area. Though Link had taken her here before, she hadn’t taken the time to explore. She suddenly saw Link leaving Sera’s sundries with the slingshot in his inventory. Midna smiled, knowing what was going to happen eventually.

The twilight princess followed Link, still hiding. As he trained with his friends, Midna thought about the possibilities. She kept thinking until the monkey showed up, leading the kids to go after it. As Link got on his horse, Midna decided to…
11.title: An old friend

choices: A couple of darknuts, making their armor weaker so the wooden sword would work
A couple of Aeralfos, forcing them to land more often to give Link a fair chance
111.content:
After a moment of thinking, Midna decided to change the challenge that Link was going to face. Something that was nice about this timeline was that it was her own, which meant she didn’t need to do research. She remembered every creature and every person they had encountered.

Midna thought about the different enemies they had faced, choosing carefully. She wanted to increase the challenge but at the same time, didn’t want to be completely cruel at the start which meant she was going to ignore Freezards and poes for right now. After some consideration, she removed some of the bokoblins and replaced them with…
111.title: A change of monsters

choices: Midna created a maze for Link to get through in order to reach Epona and Illia
Midna transformed Link just before King Bulblin showed up
1113.content:
Once the enemies had been changed, Midna smiled and sat back to watch the fight. Link soon exited the cave and traveled deeper into the woods. It wasn’t long before he encountered a redead. Link hesitated at the sight. He knew the woods could be dangerous but he had never seen anything like this. He started to approach it when it suddenly shrieked, paralyzing him.

Link struggled to move, thinking about how dangerous this thing was. Before he could react, the monster raised its weapon and delivered a mighty blow on him. The hero fell to the ground, very injured. When Midna saw this, she thought for a moment. She had wanted to see Link struggle but this was too fast. After a moment, she sighed. The woman raised her hand and healed him. As Link was trying to figure out what just happened to him, he heard a voice.

“That’s the only help you’re going to get for this fight so be prepared this time. If you really want to defeat this thing, find its weakness.” Midna whispered to him. Link had no idea where the voice came from but nodded and looked at the redead once more. After a moment, he soon realized it was actually pretty slow.

Link moved behind it and approached. It screamed once more, paralyzing him again. This time though, it didn’t have enough time to turn around. By the time it did, Link regained movement and struck at the beast. He continued this process until the monster was defeated. Link smiled and continued on.

He eventually made his way out of the fog into a clearing. In his path stood two more redeads. Link thought about this carefully before coming up with a plan. He ran to their side and approached. Midna wondered what he was up to. When he was paralyzed, the monsters raised their weapons. Before the one in front of Link could hit him though, the other one brought down its weapon without thinking and hit its ally. The redead went flying to the ground, gravely injured. Link charged at it and finished it off before it could get up. Link soon finished the other one and continued chasing Talo.

As Midna watched him, she smiled. His plan before had been brilliant and was something she hadn’t thought of. She decided to make the next challenge a little harder by making the redeads a bit faster. When the hero got to Talo and the monkey, he encountered 3 of them quickly learned of their new speed. He started dodging their attacks, keeping an eye on all of them. In the process, the monsters ended up hitting one of them off the edge.

Another redead screamed and ended up hitting Link in the chest, causing him to fall backwards. This time the damage wasn’t as bad, but it still hurt a lot, making Link slower. As Link struggled, Talo couldn’t stand it anymore.

“Monkey, you need to help him!” Talo said. The ape nodded and struck at the cage. She did this a few times before it eventually broke. With the two redeads distracted, it gave the monkey time to jump onto one of them and block their sight. The monster screamed, paralyzing the monkey but couldn’t get it off. Link used this opportunity to strike at the redead, finishing it off. Once there was only one left, Link didn’t have much trouble taking it down, finishing the fight.

As Talo and Link started walking back, Midna clapped silently. She was impressed by his performance and wondered how he would do next time. As she watched, her two wolves appeared behind her.

“Mistress, why did you help him before? I thought we were going to cause him trouble.” Amy said, confused.

“I did cause him trouble. He had a harder time this time. And anyways, this challenge was just the beginning of what we’ll throw at him.” Midna said. Amy still wasn’t entirely convinced, causing Midna to sigh. “Listen, don’t question my decision. I know what I’m doing.” The two wolves nodded and disappeared from sight.

That night, Midna appeared in Link’s bedroom. She quietly approached her sleeping friend and smiled.

“You did well today. For that, I’ll reward you.” She said softly. Using her magic, the woman healed Link’s wounds. “It’s been so long since I’ve seen you, I’m happy to be back. Today was just the start though. You’ll face challenges far greater than what happened today, and I’ll be by your side the whole time…in a way.” Midna leaned in and gave him a kiss. “Sleep well Link. You’ll have a busy day tomorrow.”

The next day…
1113.title: The beginning of a difficult journey

choices: Revealing the truth. Midna decided to let her past self come up with some ideas
Revealing the truth. Midna decided to give her a break and become Link’s partner
Being quiet. She decided to change her past self like breaking the curse
Staying silent. She decided to change what Link’s transformation was
11131.content:
As Link got ready for his trip to Hyrule Castle, Midna used her magic to see what would happen next (despite being his partner for this adventure, she wasn’t entirely sure what happened before they met). She saw that King Bulblin would arrive soon and smiled.

“Ah yes, I remember him.” She said to herself. The woman decided to change him up a bit for the future. The first thing she did was turn the king into a female. She then made her more fit and beautiful. “Now she’ll be stronger and harder to resist.” The last thing Midna did was make Queen Bulblin a bit more cruel to both her enemies and her minions.

The Twili smiled at her work and started to watch, thinking about what she should change next. Link soon reached Illia, Colin, and Epona. As Illia spoke to Link, Midna started to feel a bit jealous. After all, she lived in the same world as Link which meant Illia spent more time with him.

The moment was ruined when the two board charged through the gate. Midna watched as Link was knocked out just before their leader appeared. The woman chuckled as the monster stopped next to Link, not realizing he was there.

“Yes, this is it: the location of the final spirit.” Queen Bulblin said. She raised her horn and blew into it, making a dark portal appear above.

“Mistress, we got some interesting catches. Can we keep them?” One of the Bulblins asked, holding Colin.

“No, we’ll leave the kids somewhere to die. However, give me her.” The queen pointed to Illia. When the monster had her in hand, she gave the unconscious girl a taste. The queen moaned before licking her lips. Midna flinched as Illia started to enter the hungry mouth. After a moment, she sighed and decided to intervene.

“No, don’t eat her. You’ll eventually encounter a stronger prey, one more tasty than her.” Midna whispered to the queen. The woman hesitated before tossing Illia onto one of the boars.

“We’ll take her for now. She’s not worth eating.” The monsters all charged out, leaving Link on the ground. When he woke up, he looked around and realized what happened. He started to run after them, soon encountering the twilight realm. Before he could react, a shadow beast pulled him in.

Midna immediately hesitated when she saw the beast. It was, after all, one of her people corrupted by Zant. Zant…that name still sparked fury inside Midna. She wanted to destroy him right there and then for everything he had done and was going to do. She decided to wait though. After all, it could lead to a fun opportunity for her.

After Link transformed into a wolf, Midna followed behind, she knew her past self was also following and was careful to avoid her. The twili followed Link all the way to Hyrule Castle and watched as he was chained up. Midna decided that if she was going to change something, now would be the best time while Link was unconscious and her past self was still hiding.

She thought carefully about this. One idea she had was telling her past self what was going on and let her in on the fun in some way. It might also be interesting to see how her past self would react to some challenges that her future self would create. Midna took a second to rub her head. Thinking about a past and future self was a bit confusing. After a moment, she eventually decided on…
11131.title: Changing the strong monster leader

choices: They went to see Princess Zelda
They went to see Princess Zelda. Midna decided to make the trip harder
Midna took him to Ordon Village. She made the villagers more aggressive
Midna took him to Ordon Village. She added a new enemy for him to challenge
111312.content:
Midna smiled at her idea and waved her hand. Within a moment, her past self appeared. Imp Midna looked around, confused. She was just about to confront the wolf she had been chasing when she was suddenly teleported. Imp Midna quickly noticed her future self and became angry.

“Is this some kind of a joke? Who are you?” Past Midna demanded.

“I’m you from the future. I want to talk to you.” Future Midna responded.

“Prove it.” Future Midna nodded and grabbed her cursed shackle necklace. She showed it to her, causing the imp girl’s eyes to widen.

“I keep it as a reminder of what happened to us.” Past Midna started to calm down and looked at her.

“Why are you here?”

“The one you were about to approach is a hero and a friend. However, in my time, I’ve gained tremendous power. With it, I plan to have fun and mess with him. To do this, I came up with an idea, to switch places with you. You can relax while I help out our people.” Future Midna explained. Her past self thought about it for a minute.

She had no idea how her future self got here or how she obtained the power. However, if she was telling the truth, her future self would easily be able to save her people and stop Zant.

“Ok then. I guess I’ll trust you.” Imp Midna said. Her future self smiled and opened a portal for her, taking Imp Midna to a pocket dimension where she could hang out and have her own fun. Once her past self was gone, Midna smiled and appeared before Link, startling him.

“Hello there. My name is Midna and I’m here to help you.” She said. Link stared at her, unsure of what to do. The woman was very beautiful and appeared out of nowhere. The Twili approached him, lightly scratching Link’s chin. “I’m going to be honest with you, I’ll be giving you extra challenges on your adventure. If you decide to work with me on this, I promise you will survive. If you choose to fight me, the consequences won’t be pretty.” Link started to growl at her. He just wanted his friends to be safe. He tried to bite her, making the woman sigh.

She waved her hand and transformed him into a mouse. The boy started to freak out when he saw what she did. She now towered over him like a castle. Before he could react, Midna picked him up.

“Believe me, you don’t want to fight me. I have the power to do anything I want to you.” She said. Her stomach suddenly growled, making Link squirm. Midna thought about tasting him as a lesson of her power. After thinking about it though, she believed the point had gotten through. She set him down and transformed him back. “So, will you work with me?”

Link hesitated before nodding. Though he knew she would make things harder, he knew didn’t have much of a choice. The hero just hoped she would keep him safe like she said. Once Midna had his answer, she smiled and helped him out of the cage. Once he was free, Midna sat on his back. She was quite heavy but nothing Link couldn’t handle.

“Alright little wolf, let’s get moving.”
111312.title: Getting closer in the past

112.content:
"April, May." She calls as her two twiwolf servants appear before her.

"How may we please you our goddess?" They say in synch.

"I want the two of you to follow that boy and mess with him in any way you can think of. The more fun of a show you give me, the more I'll reward you when you get back. Any questions?"

"Any rules of what we can do to him?" May asks.

"As long as you don't kill him too quick, you can do as your hearts desire." With that, Midna poofed away in smoke, leaving the two wolves to follow the hero of twilight.

*****

April and May followed Link into a dark cave. Midna had given them knowledge of what should be Link's entire adventure, so they knew what to expect. This would be a great place to get Link while his guard is down. With their magic, they could turn the cave into a labyrinth and hunt him. Alternatively, they could summon a fog in the next area similar to the poison mist he would encounter later, only rather than poison, they could give the fog a different effect to have on the hero. Or, they could turn back and mess with the hero's now isolated mount, leaving Link to find quite the suprise when he returns.
112.title: Have April and May follow Link to mess with him

choices: Link has a run-in with one of the wolved.
Cut to Midna, making plans for later.
1121.content:
Mistress Midna wanted excitement, and what could be more exciting than watching someone get chased? Combining their magic, they turn what should've been a straightforward tunnel into a complex cave system full of dead ends and no markers. They then get into position for their part.

*****

Link was confused. He's taken this path before, it should've been a straight path from one end to another. But Link felt like he had been walking for hours. At points he thought he even saw separate tunnels. He had already emptied his only bottle of oil into his lantern, so this was it. That was when he heard it.

Howling. From two different directions he heard wolf howling. He reached for his sword, only to find himself grasping at air. Little did he know, two mischievous wolves had taken his sword and slingshot and put them at the exit of the cave, leaving him defenseless until he escaped and increasing the fear and intensity of the situation, making it more fun.

Link heard scratching and sniffing echo through the cave. They were hunting for him, and he had no way of fighting them. He knew he had to get out before one of them finds him. He began taking branching paths to try and find the exit.

What happens next?
1121.title: Transform the cave

choices: Yes, he throws her and makes his escape
11211.content:
Link was running for his life. His only hope right now was finding an exit, any exit, and getting out of here. The problem was that he was certain that he was running in circles. With nothing to tell these paths apart, he had no idea where he even was anymore. His lantern was now at only half fuel.

Then, he heard a growl. He turned around to see a wolf with strange markings covering it's body. It was slowly closing in for the kill. Link started to back away.

April couldn't believe it. She found him this quick. Her sister wasn't even close. She licked her lips as she closed in on the hero before breaking into a sprint. Planning to pounce on the defenseless hero.

Link watched as the wolf started to run at him. He couldn't outrun it. He only had one hope. He planted his feet and prepared to grab it like the goats back in Ordon.

Does he succeed?
11211.title: Link has a run-in with one of the wolves

112112.content:
April dove at Link. The hero made his move and reached for her shoulders, only to have her turn to smoke right through his arms and continue to tackle him.

She had him pinned to the ground. Struggle as he might, he couldn't throw the wolf off of him. April gave him a devilish look as a grin formed on her face. She leaned down and gave the side of his face a lick.

'Oh no, it's tasting me.' Was all that could go through his mind. Meanwhile. the complete opposite was going through her mind. She couldn't eat him now. Mistress Midna's one rule was to not kill him too fast. So instead, she decided to simply torment the boy at her mercy. Repositioning herself, she decided to ____ until May arrived.
112112.title: No, she pins him

12.content: Which adventure shall Midna go to?
12.title: Time to make a choice

choices: They set up an ambush of enemies
121.content:
The twilight princess headed for the world of masks. As she got to a dark cave, she thought about all of the changes she could make, and the fact that there were so many masks made it even better. However, she decided an immediate change was in order. Of course, she decided that she should change Link's initial appearance.

Link was chasing after the Skull Kid, bearing a heart-shaped mask, and floating above the ground as he floated away. The Link chased the creature into a hole, where, as he fell through, he saw numerous strange figures resembling bright paintings. Some he recognized, some he didn't. After a fall, he found himself upon a large, pink flower. He got to his feet, and looked around, spying a large pond. And at the other end was that Skull Kid. Midna watched as the normal events played out, up until the Skull Kid cast his curse. Then, she changed things up.

Ordinarily, Link would be transformed into a Deku Scrub, and forced to live out the next three days as one. However, instead of turning into a Deku, the hero began to shrink down, his body becoming covered in a light-green fur. The spell had turned the hero into a pup. Midna couldn't help but chuckle. She recalled how her Link would be turned into a wolf whenever he was in contact with Twilight... maybe the size of the Link determined how big the dog was. She couldn't help but chuckle about how difficult the hero's adventure might turn out now. Similarly, the Skull Kid was laughing too.

As he laughed, he floated backwards, passing through a large door with one of the black fairies in tow. He passed through, and it closed, blocking off Tatl. Familiarly, the fairy couldn't open it up, so she teamed up with Link, who could actually open up the door. This would already be a challenge for the hero, but perhaps the little guy should be shown an alpha. With a wave of her index finger, April and May spawned near the end of the path ahead of Link, with the orders to rough up Link. Now, how'd they go about it?
121.title: A Dog Eat Dog World

choices: April pounced on top of Link
1211.content:
The duo knew just how to have fun with this little guy. They also knew that they couldn't let him get away too fast. So, they set themselves at the end of the trail they knew the wolf-ized Link was going to appear at. And, sure enough, they could hear the tingle of a certain fairy approaching, meaning that adventurer must be near. They sat, waiting.

Soon, that green wolf came into view. Link was looking around, curious, and was even more confused when he spied the twili wolves. He'd been familiar with wolfos, and normal wolves. But these ones bore fur as black as shadow, pur white underbellies, and strange, neon etchings scattered about their bodies. They were also extraordinarily elegant, their frames appearing thin, yet towering over the puppified hero. They were unlike anything Link'd ever seen, mystical like fairies, yet they seemed drenched in some sort of deviousness.

One of the two got up off of her rump, and walked around Link to the back.

"Well, well, well, what have we here?" the one going behind Link said. "Some ignorant rascal decided to wander onto our turf?"

"I think he's trying to intrude on our quarters," the one still sitting said.

"Who the heck are you guys?" Tatl said, confused. In all the times she visited here, she'd never seen these two.

"You don't know us? I'm April," the one sitting said. She bore some more bluish neon lights.

"And I'm May," the one rounding to the back said. She bore darker green neon lights. "We're alphas around here. And I guess that means someone's gotta teach you who the superiors are."
1211.title: They confront Link themselves

12112.content:
Before Link could react, April suddenly jumped forward and knocked Link onto his back. As he was stunned, April stood over him, smiling. As Tatl tried to help, May pounced and swiped at her, knocking her unconscious and leaving Link to fend for himself. May got around to the other side of Link and looked at her friend.

"So what shall we do? Should we sit on him?" May asked. As April thought, Link was getting worried. He still wasn't used to being a wolf, and that was a huge advantage for them. As he tried to get on his feet, April put her paw on him, keeping him on his back.

"Perhaps we should feed the fairy to him, a small wolf does need its nutrition, and that fairy is the perfect size for him." April suggested. As they discussed the situation, Midna couldn't help but smile as she watched. She excitedly waited to see what they decided on.

"You know, I think we should. . ."
12112.title: Two Wolves, One Furry Hero

121123.content:
"Perhaps you're right. He does need to eat if he wants to grow up big and strong." May says before walking over to Tatl and grabbing her wings in her mouth.

"Now open wide little one and say 'aaaaah'." April says, using her other paw to force open the hero's mouth. May had returned with the fairy still in her mouth. Link tried his hardest to push these two off him, or at least close his mouth to prevent them from doing what they were about to do, but to no avail. May dropped the still unconscious fairy into Link's mouth, easily sliding down his throat and into his stomach.

Link began to tear up. First Navi, then Epona, and now the only traveling companion he had just got eaten... by him. To top it off, he had no idea where he was or how to turn human again. Tears began to roll down the hero's face. His canine tormentors saw this and started to laugh at him.

"I believe that's enough for now. Come sister, let us return." May said as she started walking away. April on the other hand, had other plans.

"Wait sister. We can't leave this weak, defenseless, pitiful puppy out here all alone." She says with emphasis on the taunts. "Perhaps we should adopt him sister. Make him our precious little puppy wuppy. We can train him to accept us as his mothers."

How does May respond?
121123.title: feed tatl to him

choices: The two wolves report to Midna
The two wolves prepare a surprise for Link
1212.content:
The two wolves decided to “train” Link to fight as a wolf. With their powers combined, they created two floor masters ready for a battle. Link kept running until he encountered them. His eyes widened when he saw them. He remembered them from his last adventure and they were not easy to defeat, and that was when he was in his true form. As the small wolf tried to run around them, one of them grabbed him by the leg.

“Link watch out!” Table yelled, dodging the other master barely. April and May giggled as Link was tossed against the wall. He got up and charged at the monster, biting it’s finger. Link scratched as it with his paws, causing the beast to flail around in panic and soon disappearing in defeat. “Ah!” Table yelled. Link quickly looked over to see his new fairy companion being grabbed and squeezed by the other floor master. The courageous wolf jumped at it and attacked. The monster was soon defeated as well, leaving Tatl and Link by themselves.

April and May were interested by his fight. They did not expect him to survive with only a couple of scratches.

“So that’s why Midna is interested in him.” May said. Her friend nodded and they both decided to fall back for now.
1212.title: Smaller, but not weakened

choices: The Mask Salesman. His smile was friendly, if not a bit disconcerting.
May. Her cheshire grin could easily be mistaken for a wolfish snarl.
12121.content:
The journey to Clock Town was mostly uneventful. No more ambushes. No more Skull Kid. No more April or May.
         However, just before a shaded stone tunnel was a small dead tree. It was unusual — it had hollowed, half-circle eyes carved into the wood. A twisted, circular snout protruded from its wooden features. Two thin twigs jutted from its sides like a pair of spindly arms. It seemed to be an effigy of a deku scrub: a diminutive plant-like creature with wooden skin and eyes that glowed like enkindled wood. An aura of sadness seemed to extrude from its very wood. Link expected to pass it right by, but after it caught his eye, he couldn’t seem to pull them away. It felt familiar, in a distant sense. For some reason, he couldn’t but help but think of himself when he looked at the tree — even though he had nothing in common with it.
         “It’s strange,” Tatle said floating above and just to the left of Link’s right ear, “it looks all dark and gloomy... almost like it could start crying any second now.” There was a moment of silence before Tatl noticed something.
         “A mask!” she said. “Right there, by the roots!” Indeed, there was a mask. It was of a deku scrub — alive and not a twisted effigy like the tree that stood above it. The mask laid face up, half-turned away from the heroic duo. Curiously, Link swore it was not there a second ago. Nevertheless, he approached it and picked it up in his jaws. It tasted like bark, shedding light on its composition.
         “It’s really life-like.” Tatl said, hovering an inch away from the mask’s wooden surface. She floated up a bit, fluttering in front of her canine companion’s nose and eyes. “I think it’d be a real shame to leave it here, don’t you think? You should hold on to it. Maybe it’ll be useful for something!” With a nod and a muffled bark, Link agreed and they continued their journey.
         The heroic duo marched through the stone tunnel and into a strange, twisting passage. As they traveled through, their sense of up, down, left, right, and even time were distorted. At the end of the tunnel was a door and behind it was the start of their adventure.

▲          ▲          ▲

▲ ▲

         Link and Tatl were greeted by the sound of heavy machinery. A great water wheel was spinning, powering the many cogs and mechanisms that operated the great clock tower. The odor of mildew was prevalent along with the metallic scent of rust and metal. They were most certainly underground: in the basement of Clock Town’s greatest work.
There was a wooden ramp that lead upwards. Link approached it, confidently setting a paw on the cool, dampened wood. It creaked ominously. The sound eerily echoed across the hard stone interior. Link waited a moment, decided it was sturdy enough, and continued upwards.
         The heroes’ ascent ended in a simple stone room. Yellowed blocks of granite comprised both the ceiling and the floor. A large wooden door marked with faded red and blue paint marked their exit. Link made a cursory glance around, to see if there was anything of note within this room. Finding nothing, he went for the door. But was stopped by a unfamiliar voice.
         “You’ve met a terrible fate, haven’t you?”
         Link’s ears perked up. Turning his head, he saw…
12121.title: A Terrible Fate?

choices: ...eased slightly. He was willing to let her talk.
121212.content:
“Expecting someone else?” May said as she began to saunter toward the heroic duo. Bedraggled dark hair encompassed her entire form. Cyan, neon markings drew mysterious sharp patterns across her fur. Her eyes gleamed with a mischievous menace.
         Link dipped low and growled, dropping the Deku Mask from his fangs. It hit the ground with a hollow clatter. The resulting sound filled the room, bouncing from stone wall to stone wall.
         Link’s look was sharper than any sword. His body was tensed and his jaws snapped — ready to fight or flee. May stifled a bubbling laugh with her paw.
         “Oh ho my! You seem vexed. Can’t imagine why.” May continued her advancement. Her stride had lost no confidence. “You should be glad we got rid of this tower’s...previous occupant. I’m certain he wouldn’t of taken kindly to your wolfish intrusion.”
         She was now snout-to-snout with Link, neither daring to submissively lower their head. “You’re cute to me, pup. Not so much to others.” May said. Her own eyes momentarily contested Link’s glare, but finally relented as she turned her head up and away. She seemed disappointed.
         “You really aren’t appreciating what we’re doing for you. We’re giving you a fighting chance. We trained you how to fight. April disposed of a potentially-troublesome character. We’re here to help you.” May looked back at Link. Our hero…
121212.title: A Terrible Fate...

choices: Venture through the large doors and into the unknown. Look for the Keaton!
Search for the man May claimed April disposed of. He may be able to help!
1212121.content:
Link’s fangs missed May by a hair’s width — literally. The Twili-wolf moved in the nick of time; Link snagged a few of her shadowy hairs in his front teeth. May’s demeanor instantly soured.
         “Brave. Not clever.” May hissed like a fiendish cat. “If words aren’t going to help you, maybe actions will.” May stepped forward once again, her chest held high. Link became aware of how truly large she was compared to his diminutive size.
         “Your first quest begins now. I’m going to give you a motivation.” Faster than a Garo’s strike, May lunged jaws above Link — toward the glowing ball of light fluttering over him. Tatl tried to move, but was quickly enclosed within May’s maw. Golden light shone through the Twili-wolf’s fangs, but was extinguished when her lips concealed them like a black curtain.
         Link moved to attack! But, May had the size-advantage. She effortlessly body-checked him away, sending him crashing into the hard stone wall. May waited until the wolf lifted his head and looked back at her before smiling. Tatl’s frantic struggles clearly seen from the flickering light within. The front of May’s jaws shone brilliantly as the fairy inside rammed against them, trying to break free.
         Then, May looked skyward. Her head was lifted high, her fur-coated neck clearly visible. Suddenly, the light in her jaws fizzled out as her lupine tongue grappled the fairy and dragged her downward. Tatl tried to break free from its slimy embrace, but in vain. She was dragged through the spittle that was collected at the bottom of May’s maw and was slowly draining down into the dark abyss that laid in the back. Far too dark to be illuminated by Tatl’s measly light — at least at her current position. A position which was about to be changed.
May swallowed.
         A faint glow traveled down from the top of the wolf’s throat. It’s radiance dimmed as it traveled down…
         And down…
         And down…
         ...Until it reached the Twili-wolf’s collarbone. In which, it vanished.
         May smiled widely and wildly. She began to speak. Her mouth movements were exaggerated to show that there was no doubt that they were now empty.
         “Find the golden Keaton who hides in a circle of grass. Survive its trial and your fairy-friend survives her’s.”
         With that, a strange portal with a neon pattern similar to May’s own materialized. The wolf disintegrated into dark specks and vanished — leaving Link alone. The small wolf slowly stands. Pain shoots up his paws when they bear his weight. Yet, he still stands. His back aches, but he holds himself high.
         A time limit much shorter than three days has now been imposed. What is Link’s first move?

After expending most of his seeds and getting smooched by the (admittedly cute) ghost girl every time he missed, Link finally had it! He couldn't lose, especially since her challenge was so simple; some hero he could be if he couldn't even aim at anything that wasn't a sitting duck. The problem was that she was way too fast, and she knew where he was shooting from at all times. How could he slow her down long enough to pull a win...?

As he was pondering this, the ghost blew a kiss to him. What he didn't expect was the kiss to become tangible, fly over, and land on his cheek. Being caught off guard by it, he blushed even more intensely than when she first kissed him. Instead of disappearing, it continued to plant itself against his face and press down. After a few seconds of stunned embarrassment, Link ripped it off of him and threw it away, the ghoul in front of him to giggling to herself all the while. She made a kissy face at him, but was merciful enough to not summon a pair of lips again. As oddly pleasant as it was being pecked by this girl, it was starting to get a bit too distracting. Wait a minute...That's it!

Link grabbed one of the few seeds left in his pouch and loaded it into his slingshot. The ghost girl smiled coyly at him and stood still, same as the last twenty-something times; meanwhile, the adventurer in green pretended like he was concentrating on landing a shot, when he was really trying to whiff it. When he launched, she just dodged to the side like usual, and came in to collect her prize.

Thinking quickly, Link gripped his slingshot and stood still until the last possible second. Right when the ghost closed her eyes and puckered up, he swayed to the side so she missed him, snatching a seed from his bag and tossing it into his slingshot hand in the process; then, when she was turning to smooch him, he grabbed her by the waist with his free hand and smashed his lips into hers.

Amy had no idea how to react; she felt exactly like he did when he got his first kiss stolen by her!

He brushed his lips along hers; she's really taught him a lot about kissing, after all! He was just following her example. This did nothing to lessen the blush on his face, or the fact that he was kind of getting into it himself...

Gah! Stop it, Link, you've got a challenge to fulfill!

Pulling himself out of his kiss-induced daze, Link went in for the kill, running his tongue across the ghost girl's lower lip. "Nnngh...Ah!" She moaned, melting into his embrace. Her eyes lidded, and eventually closed completely as she reciprocated the lip-lock she was getting.

This was his chance! Wrapping his free arm around her waist, he loaded the seed into his slingshot, pushed her away, and fired at her forehead.

"W-wai-"

THWACK!!

"OWWW!" Amy yelped, rubbing her head, which now had a comically large bump on it. Link pumped his arm in success. "H-hey! No fair!" she huffed, crossing her arms and pouting. Link couldn't help but think she was really cute like this. "Y-you cheated! You tricked me! That doesn't count..." she ranted.

Link explained to her that he didn't break any rules; all he had to do was hit the target with his seedling, and he most certainly did just that. Amy tried to come up with something to stop him from progressing, but she couldn't; he was absolutely right. He won (not so) fair and square, and there was nothing she could do about it. "Fine...you can go ahead and meet my sisters, I guess..." she sighed and hung her head, moping to herself. Link could've sworn that he heard her mutter 'jerk' under her breath. “Of course, sister! Have fun with the little voe till your heart’s content,” Buliara sings, still not bothering to pull up her pants. She steps aside to let her Gerudo sister have her turn. Link looks up at the woman and is startled by what he sees. That’s no Gerudo at all!

Mida stands above Link, choosing this time to appear to him in her true form rather than her imp form. In her true form, the Twilight Princess looks as elegant and regal as she does drop-dead sexy. She boasts an unbelievably leggy and curvaceous figure beneath a tight, scantily-clad outfit an exotic belly-dancer might wear. Unfamiliar with the Twili in this timeline, Link merely looks at Midna with stunned awe, but with a snap of her fingers Link’s mind is suddenly filled with memories from another timeline, allowing him to instantly recognize her.

She flashes him an impish smile that he’d recognize no matter what form she’s in. “What’s the matter, Link? Surprised to see a multi-dimensional goddess,” she taunts. “Hope you like what i’ve done with the place, cause you and I are gonna have lots of fun in this sandbox of a world you got here.” She turns around, showing off her trademark, jaw-dropping rear. “But first: how’s about a seat?” Midna promptly sits down onto Link’s crotch, effortlessly knocking the wind out of him as her lower body engulfs his.

She grinds her hips left and right, skifully shimmying her ass in a way that stiffens his member against her almost immediately. “Now, I know what you’re thinking: how’s a Twili like me able to get along so well with all these Gerudo women,” she says coyly, knowing damn well that most of Link’s thoughts are on her bouncy ass. “Well that’s all thanks to a handy illusion spell I whipped up. Right now, everyone here except you sees me as a fellow Gerudo woman.” Midna gestures to Buliara, as well as the crowd of women watching, all of them cheering Midna on as if she were one of their one. Buliara in particular watches raptly, eagerly looking for inspiration for the next time she has her turn with Link.

“Don’t get me wrong, though: these curves are still 100% real,” Midna caveats, taking Link’s hand and forcing him to grope her vast chest while she continues to grind her plump ass against his crotch. Even while smack dab in the middle of a village packed with voluptuous amazons, the Twilight Princess’ bombastic figure is more than capable of standing out in a crowd. “Just consider this illusion spell the mystical equivalent of a palette swap...not that you’d know what that means,” she snickers. Normally Link would be annoyed at Midna’s condescending tone, but it’s hard to focus on anything else besides the copious amounts of female flesh pressing against his nearly naked body.

“Really, all you need to worry about are the oodles of surprises and plans I have in store for you. Depending on how well you play along, the two of us will never be bored again.” Before Link can even manage to get a word in edgewise, Mida turns and gives him a breathtaking kiss, overwhelming his face with her plump lips. “*Mwah* I’m looking forward to it.~”

Options:
1. Midna keeps playing with Link herself
2. Midna asks Buliara if she wants to share Link for now
3. Midna suddenly has to go, but she has a surprise for Link
154212435.title: Midna reveals herself to Link

1542124353.content:
Just as Midna has Link practically swooning from all her teasing, she stands back up, surprising both Link and everyone watching. There’s so much Midna would loooove to do to Link right now, but deep down she knows it’s too soon. With all the fun she has in store for him, she can’t have him blowing his wad too soon.~ She wants him primed and ready first, which means they have to pace themselves.

“While I do ever so enjoy our time together, Linkie, especially the moments when I make you scream and moan beneath me, I’m afraid I’ll have you cut things short for now. You know how it is for a mystical princess: things to do, people to see, mischief to make (especially for you), “ she says while dusting herself off. But don’t worry: I know you’d be oh so lonely while I’m gone, so I arranged for you to have a playmate while I’m gone, an old *ahem* friend of yours,” Midna adds with a mischievous smile.

“She’s actually here, disguised by my spell, and she’s been dying to see you again.” At Midna’s signal, another “Gerudo” approaches from the crowd, and Link’s eyes widen in shock at the woman’s true form. Midna giggles “Arranging a playdate for you; aren’t I such a kind and gracious princess?~ By, Linkie, try not to have too much fun while I’m gone.” Midna winks and disappears into the crowd, leaving Link alone with his ‘friend.’

Who is it?
1542124353.title: Midna leaves but leaves Link with a "friend"

choices: Midna visits another part of the map
She hears from the wolves - Link has been found!
15422.content:
As much as Midna was looking forward to seeing Buliara torment Link, she wanted to make his path to Gerudo a bit more challenging. So she quickly left the dessert and travelled to Goron City, home of the Goron tribe. On arrival, she shuddered briefly at the sight of the rough, round race.

She quickly added a bit of a gentler look to the female Gorons in the city, changing their bodies from having just a single curve to very full, curvaceous forms. She still kept their tough skin, thick mass, and large stature, but felt this was a much more appropriate look for a female.

Oh, and she also planted the same seed of desire from Paya within each and every one of them.

Midna's eyes sparkle with delight and joy and she hasn't even found Link yet!
15422.title: Visit Goron City

choices: He approaches one of Midna’s female gorons
154221.content:
As fate would have it, Midna saw a unique figure, quickly making his way towards the settlement in the volcanic region. Though his clothes were differant from the usual, there was no mistaking it. This was the Link of this timeline.he appeared to be exhausted, struggling from both the climb and the lethal heat. Midna could sense that the hero are or drank something to help him resist it, but this was a temporary measure at best. Deciding to throw the hero a small bone, as if to make up for what she set up for him to face, the twilight princess waved an arm and secretly granted Link a natural resistance to the extreme heat. After all, he’ddefinitely need it if all goes according to plan.

As he made his way in, the hero get an odd calming feeling, as if the bombarding heat had somehow let up. This being a volcano, he knew that wasn’t the case, but at least he seemed to be safe here somehow. Maybe the goddesses were smiling on him. If only he knew the truth behind this gift.

As he made his way in, he looked around at the inhabitants while Midna stealthily followed from the shadows prepared to make any other necessary changes, should the need arise. Finally he approached an inhabitant.
154221.title: Link arrives at Goron City

choices: Midna leaves them alone for now and prepares for the next day
Midna removes the shyness and makes her more open and assertive
Midna goes overboard. The Goron becomes fiercely possessive of the hero
Midna brings another goron into this.
1542212.content:
As the hero looked around the settlement he saw a strange dimorphism among the inhabitants. While they were all tall, fat, and rocky beings, a good number took of a strangely curvier shape compared to the others, almost resembling the females of the other races. Link didn't think the Gorons even had standard genders like the rest, but apparently some do.

His curiosity caused him to approach one of the females. Midna watched from the literal shadows with baited breath. She quietly caused the other gorons to ignore the hero, curious to see how her work would do in a one on one situation and if any further improvements were needed. To the hero's surprise, the moron was slightly flustered at the first sight of him before the two began talking, asking about the settlement and the divine beast nearby. Though Midna was pleased with her handiwork so far, she realized that basing the personality changes off of Paya might have made her a bit too nervous or shy to make this really interesting. She heard the moron offering Link a place to stay in her home to rest before continuing his climb. An offer the hero accepted. The twilight goddess knew this had some potential, but she pondered if she should make the goron more assertive.
1542212.title: He approaches one of Midna’s female gorons

1542213.content:
To Midna’s dismay, the hero ended up making his way through the settlement with little to no problems. Oh well, he still had to return through here eventually. If only for supplies. However, a new opportunity soon arose for the shadowy creature when Link finally came across the defendant of the champion of the gorons.

Seeing Link Saving him from being trapped under a rockslide, Midnalooked at the new figure with curiosity and glee. Aside from his already huge build giving him a lot of potential, Midna could instinctively tell that this was someone vital to Link’s quest. Someone he couldn’t simply walk past or ignore like the villagers from before. A smirk formed as she continued plotting the goron’s potential.

However, to both Link’s and Midna’s surprise, the goron suddenly panicked, mistaking the much smaller link for a monster and quickly fleeing. “Hmmmm... this one will need some work.” Midna thought to herself, but then a sly grin formed as she pondered the many possibilities that this large, bulky coward could provide. She could just make an instantaneous change and catch Link off guard, or she could make it a slow process, gradually making the shy goron bolder, more assertive, and most importantly, planting in a desire to dominate Link into his mind. Possibly even an attraction like the others for good measure. It was sure to be an amusing spectacle either way, especially after this introduction.

She decided to basically make herself like an extra divine beast,it could be fun
Her companions suddenly messaged her that Link was at Hateno
15423.content:
Midna went to Vah Naboris first since it was the closest divine beast to her. She used her magic to change it into a humanoid female creature, but she made it so the divine beast still walked on all fours. She then made the creature invincible so it couldn’t be destroyed, but left the weakness at the end of its limbs so that Link could bring it down. The twilight being also made sure that Link had to go through the divine beast’s mouth to get in(making sure it wouldn’t digest him, and left the layout pretty similar to the original besides the fact that it was now an organic creature).

The next thing Midna did was give Vah Naboris some intelligence. She made sure the creature could recognize Link and want to toy with him and Riju. She also made sure the divine beast could speak. One more thing Midna did was change the lightning attack so it would mainly stun Link so it could catch him.

Midna went to Vah Medoh and basically did the same for it(giving it a more female humanoid form, making sure it could speak and recognize Link and his ally, having to enter its mouth). A special thing Midna did though was give the divine beast a stable nest at the top of Talonto mountain as a place to take Link to to play with him.

Midna went to Vah Rudania and made the same changes as the other two. A special change for this divine beast though was the sentries it sent out also had a humanoid appearance now and could grab Link. Midna also made it easy for Link to enter and exit Vah Rudania’s mouth once it had fallen into the volcano (since the main terminal was on the outside of the body).

Vah Ruta was next. Midna made her normal changes to it just like the others. For this one however, Midna made the divine beast a bit slimmer than normal elephants. She also made sure it would be able to suck Link up with its trunk(if Link found himself alone in the water).

Midna made sure the insides of their bodies wouldn’t digest Link(to give him a chance) and smiled at her work. This idea really interested her. It kind of made her want to act like divine beast herself, but that couldn’t happen…… or could it?

Midna thought about this for a second.

1543.content:
As Midna thought about what to change next, she suddenly heard a message in her head.

"Princess! We found him, he is in Kakariko village." Midna head May said.

"Very good, I'll be there right away." Midna sent the message back and teleported to Link's location. Midna landed on a hill and looked down to see the hero in a hood heading up Impa's stairs. She watched Link approach the entrance when she saw Paya blush at Link. Midna smirked, thinking about how she could use Paya. With a wave of her hand, Midna made Paya want Link a lot. The twilight princess smiled at Link's embarrassment and eventually made Paya get off.

"Hello hero, it's nice of you to deliver yourself to me. I want to face you head on. You won't win, but I want to see how long you last." Midna said, getting her weapon (the twilight mirror) ready. Link prepared himself as well when Midna suddenly stopped him. "Hold on, you're not ready yet. Let me change you a little." Midna said…

15432.content:
Link questioned what this strange woman was doing as she snapped her fingers and nothing happened. Rather than waste time pondering though, Link seized the opportunity and attacked with a jump slash. Midna dodged, but was "knocked" to the ground. Link proceeded with a follow-up attack, only to be stopped dead in his tracks at what he saw.

This woman looked so... beautiful. She looked like a fallen angel as she lay on the ground, seemingly defenseless. Meanwhile, Midna fought back her grin to keep up this powerless act. "H-how dare you attack a lady who was unprepared." Link was so lost in the beauty of her body that he dropped his shield.

Smirking at the effect she was having on him, Midna sprung up and lwapt into the air. She put her hand to her puckered lips and prepared for an attack. Focusing her magic on her lips, she lets out an exaggerated "Mwah" as she shoots down a fast-moving pair of pink lips made of magic. The attack landed successfully, sending Link flying and knocking the sword from his hand. It also further strengthened the aphrodisiac spell she put on him. Now she had him. What next though?

This was it. Midna had Link head over heels for her. Now all she needed to do was seal the deal. She brought the Twilight Mirror before her and focused her powers. From the mirror emerged three copies of herself, all ready and willing to toy with the lovestruck hero. Link rose back to his feet, only to fall back down at what he saw.

The mysterious beauty that had captured his heart was standing there, looking even more beautiful than before. But now, there were four of her, each as angelic as the last. He thought his heart would stop out of sheer excitement as his jaw dropped. The four goddesses giggled at his stunned reaction.

"Oh lover boy." The original called out. "We would love to have some more... 'adult' fun with you, bit first you need to do one little thing for us..." As she says this, the other three Midnas bring their hands to their lips and prepare another projectile smooch attack. "Don't dodge this." She finishes as she brings her hand to her own lips.

She was going to love Link following her every order, no matter what, all in an attempt to please her. She also couldn't wait for all the naughty things she planned to do to him in the bedroom. The four Midnas let loose their attacks, sending four pairs of magical lips flying at Link.

Link, meanwhile, was in conflict with himself. Did he dodge, or did he simply want to please these four goddesses? So many questions ran through his head, he barely registers the attacks heading for him. What should he do?

He kept fighting with himself, shouting at himself to move, to avoid their attacks. But this stalemate made him unable to move. Link was too distracted with arguing with himself before moving, and it took him a few moments to realize the lips were eclipsing him. And then... contact.

"Just gotta check that it's worked," the original said. She then picked up a bare foot, and held it before Link. "Massage." At that, Link snapped to attention. He leaned towards that fought, and brought up his hands, carefully wrapping them around her foot. And then, he rubbed and squeezed, carefully kneading it. Midna sighed at that. "Mmm~ Oh I think this'll work..." she said. The four Midnas glanced at each other, and pondered what they should do to this hero now?

In the end, the four ordered Link to...

15521.content:
As Midna sat on her throne, she looked through the different worlds. Each contained interesting options, but that fact made it hard to decide. She looked through her options multiple times, carefully deciding.

"Too bad I can't just create a new time period." She thought to herself. However, her search soon slowed down to a stop as she thought more about it. "A new time. . ." Midna concentrated and thought deeply. "Perhaps. . . maybe I could. I have the power, I could make challenges. I wonder. . ." After a minute of thinking, the Twilight Princess smiled. "Well, let me give it a shot. It's not like I have to worry about consequences." With a snap of her fingers, she teleported out of her world and created a new one.

It was just an empty void of nothing, but that gave Midna room to work with. She decided to follow the goddesses footsteps by creating Hyrule similar to how they did. She started with creating the land, adding landmarks like Death mountain, Lake Hylia, a snowy mountain and other areas. She made the world quite big and added some some towns for later and made sure to put Hyrule castle in the center. One more location she added was a special forest with a deep cave, this would be infested with a lot of monsters later.

Next, Midna added universal laws and physics just like Nayrue. She didn't change much at all for this part, Midna didn't feel the need to make thing's different.

The next part was the segment that Midna was waiting for, adding life to the world. She first started with the normal Hylians, starting off small. She made the shopkeepers more aggressive and powerful. If Link went into a shop but didn't buy anything, the shopkeepers could make Link pay in some way. Midna added one more touch to the common folks, a few would actually be monsters who look like Hylians.

She then added the Gorons and made them rock and meat eaters. For Zoras, she added them with the feeling of great dominance and superiority over other creatures. Midna also added the Rito, adding only a few, but made them large enough to be able to hold a Hylian in their claws/feet. The Gerudo was next, and she kept them the same except for one detail. If a man was caught in their territory, the intruder would have a much rougher time than just being locked up.

The enemies were next, and she made sure to add quite a few. She made sure to add Bokoblins, Moblins, Lizalfos, and Chuchus. The Twilight Princess made sure to make them aggressive and love dominating creatures like Hylians.

Midna finally created princess Zelda, and made her quite smart and kind, but playful and mischievous at times. Link wasn't changed, but that was the challenge. Midna put Link in a small town called Norwich and decided to make both him and Zelda adults. As she created them, she made sure to create the Triforce and give the two their pieces.

Her final step was to invade the kingdom she just made and start Link on his quest. To start, she decided to. . .

What now?

When Impa saw him her hear melted, the boy was so cute! She had the urge to pick him up and set him on her lap and protect him from everything.

Impa crept forward "Hello little one" Impa said softly, Link turned and yelped when he saw the massive woman. "No no no, don't be afraid little one, I'm the head guard and I'm just wondering why you are here." Impa asked tilting her head slightly. Impa frowned at the story, yes the hero is supposed to be dressed in green and have blond hair but he was way to young to be the hero. Although there was no else with that description. Either way she felt bad for the boy who was kicked out of his home for no valid reason.

155231.content:
"Eenie, meenie, miney... you!" Midna says as she finally chooses a world and heads in, completely unknowing of where she is heading. She enters the world and ghosts herself so she can look around. From what she can see though, this Hyrule looks rather... plain, with very little to make it unique from other worlds.

"Whatever. I'm not here to sightsee, I'm here to screw with Link and that's what I'm gonna do. Now I just need to sense out that hero's spirit every Link has aaaanndd... gotcha." She takes off in the direction she sensed Link was in.

She soon came upon a cuckoo farm. "Rather plain for a hero." Midna muses to herself before remembering that her own Link started out as a simple goat herder. "Now where are you Link?"

She flies inside right to where she senses the hero's spirit. Only instead of the standard elf-eared mute boy she was expecting, it was a girl. She looked about the age of the average Link, and even looked a lot like him, but it couldn't be, could it? She takes a quick look into what this world is to see what's happening.

Apparently, in this world, rather than Link, the hero destined to defeat evil was instead a girl named Linkle. Well this certainly put a damper on Midna's plans, but not enough to stop her. Male or female, a Link was a Link, and this "Linkle" was a Link alright. She would certainly have fun with her.

But first, she needed more intel on this world. For starters, was everyone in this world a gender-bent version of their traditional counterparts, or was Link/Linkle the only one to get that treatment?
155231.title: A Link by any other name...

1553.content:
One is a Link who is adrift at sea and unconscious, yet also within the dream of the Wind Fish. Were Midna to take over the dream, shed be able to twist Link's dream into either a wet dream or a nightmare.

Perhaps both? an erotic nightmare, where all the monsters, their bosses, and even the friendly villagers are all Midna?

===

But what's this?

A Link that talks a lot? A Link that makes puns as he fights? A Link that's a egotistical horndog?

Preposterous!

But yet, he exists.

Perhaps Midna might feel like taking him down a peg. Perhaps Midna might match wits with him.

Or perhaps Midna might decide to show him what a real woman is like, so that he becomes her boytoy, one that is willing to throw everything away for another touch from his master?

===

Or perhaps the Link from Super Smash Brothers? He's kind of a catch-all Link, one with a little bit of everything from all the series.

Perhaps Midna and Bayonetta might team up, so that Link can face a double helping of domination from the duo of dominating beauties?

===

What about the Link from the timeline where Ganon is killed once and for all? Yes, this is the Link from the very first two games, the one that rescued one Princess Zelda in the first game, then saved her ancestor in the second game.

Yes, this is a Link with two Princess Zeldas!

Perhaps Midna might take over the role of Bad guy? I mean, the role is now vacant.
Perhaps Midna might be an official ambassador? Hyrule is in rather bad shape, so she could either help out enough that they worship her instead of the three goddesses or whatever religion they have.
1553.title: Yet more worlds for the Twilight Princess

info.brief_description: When one Twilight Princess gets bored, she has a dear Hylian to entertain herself with.
info.description:
Midna, the famous Twilight Princess, grew into a powerful being. In addition to her normal powers, she even acquired god-like abilities. Unfortunately, when you become a god, you get bored easily. Midna's growing bored with her life in her kingdom. However, there's one game she's yet to play. And she knows the perfect little pawn.

She has the power to go from timeline to timeline, and uses this power to find the "Link" of that world, and then mess with them. Now, she couldn't simply mess with him outright. That'd be too easy. No, she could rearrange that world to present a little play-area for him. She can make the people/monsters of the world be more... aggressive with him. And she'd love nothing more than to see some adventurer struggle to avoid some powerful creature's dominating aura. Whether they eat him, sit on him, or -ahem- play with him, she wants to savor every moment of the poor adventurer's humiliation. And even if Link falls in battle, she can just rewind time to before he loses, just so she can watch him struggle some more.

Whenever she gets her sights on a Link, she usually thrusts some handicap on him, with the end goal of finding and defeating her in battle, though she promises there's no way he'll win. Handicaps can range from turning him into a wolf, to making him gummy, to making him feel especially submissive, and so much more. And, as if that isn't bad enough, she's got a duo of dangerous female twili-wolves, April and May, to hunt him down. Usually when she hosts a game, she'll have these two hidden somewhere. When the game starts, they leave their hiding spot, with the goal of finding and dominating the adventurer. If they find him, there's no telling what they'll do. If Link isn't moving constantly, he could become victim to April and May's domineering attitude.

Rules
1. At the beginning, players will be able to choose a timeline for this event to take place in. Please keep relevant beings, besides Midna and her Twili, in their respective timelines.
2. At the beginning, don't create a dead end for timelines for the story to follow.
3. Refrain from excessive gore, watersports, scat, and detailed digestion.
4. Doms of either gender are fine, but they have to be at least older than 18.
5. Don't be nonsensical with your next entry. There should be a relatively understandable flow to the plotline.
6. Feral and anthro doms are allowed.
7. Don't end plotlines too soon.
8. The game isn't restricted to canon "worlds," meaning the Link could be from a made up Timeline. However, if you make up a Timeline, you should explain a few details about it.
